properties.NAME: The Gurdon Light
properties.DESCRIPTION: An ominous floating light seen near railroad tracks in a wooded area of Gurdon, said to be the lantern light of William McClain, a railroad foreman who was killed in the area during a confrontation with one of his workers.

properties.NAME: Avon Cemetary
properties.DESCRIPTION: It is said if you drop a rock in the well located in the middle of the cemetary, you'll hear the cries of a baby whose mother was drawing water form the well when he/she accidentally fell in and drowned. Local tales also say the mother can be seen running through the cemetary at night.

properties.NAME: Peppersauce Ghost Town
properties.DESCRIPTION: Abandoned East Calico, a street lined with ghostly overgrown buildings that have seen better days, markers in front of many tell the stories of their past.

properties.NAME: Rush Ghost Town
properties.DESCRIPTION: Population 0, Rush was once a prosperousmining community, now completely abandoned, visitors are just asked to be respectful of the structures.

properties.NAME: Cresent Hotel
properties.DESCRIPTION: Opened first as a resort, second as a college for girls, then as a hospital and fianally as the hotel we know today. Much of the legends surroun the hospital days of the hotel when the corrupt 'doctor' Norman Baker killed hundreds of cancer patients with his 'cure'.

properties.NAME: Boggy creek Monster
properties.DESCRIPTION: Best described as a big-foot type creature with numerous claimed sightings that gave rise to the movie The Boggy Creek Monster and it's sequel.

properties.NAME: Dehorn's Grave
properties.DESCRIPTION: The haunted grave of Reverend William Dehorn who was a known fortune teller from the late 1800's to the early 1900's. His headstone sits away from he rest in a very rural African American cemetery where it is surrounded by sandy ground and large cacti.

properties.NAME: Fouke Monster
properties.DESCRIPTION: Back in May of 1971, 25 year-old Bobby Ford reported to the Fouke constable that he had heard screams of fright from the womenfolk at his place. When he went to investigate he was attacked by a seven-foot-tall, red-eyed ape-man. In 1971, the constable said that there had been a sighting of an ape-man back in 1963 and that several shots had been fired at it.

properties.NAME: Petit Jean's grave
properties.DESCRIPTION: Many legends surround the mysterious life of Petit Jean, whose grave can be found here on Stout's Point.

properties.NAME: Ivory-billed Woodpecker
properties.DESCRIPTION: Hopefully someday this won't be considered an Arkansas legend, but for now its existence is unknown.

properties.NAME: Crossroads Ghost Town
properties.DESCRIPTION: This ghost town has been submerged under Lake Maumelle.  Town and cemetery both under water.
